item.title: DOJ Fines Minnesota Restaurant For Verifying Immigrant Work Permits
item.description: The Justice Department reached an 11th-hour settlement with a Minnesota-based restaurant chain with a $95,000 civil penalty.

item.title: Pete Hegseth Makes The Definitive Case Why He’s Qualified To Be Trump’s Defense Secretary
item.description: Pete Hegseth provided his best case yet on why he's the perfect man to be President-elect Donald Trump's defense secretary.

item.title: NBC White House Correspondent Yamiche Alcindor Doesn’t Deserve A Seat In The Briefing Room
item.description: Alcindor is not in the press room for reporting, but to plant seeds that will grow into narratives the left wants the public to believe.

item.title: Leftist New Mexico Secretary Of State Settles Lawsuit In ‘Win For Election Transparency’
item.description: State elections officials had planned to charge PILF $5,000 for voter records. After the settlement, the fee is $600.

item.title: Ohio’s New Parental Rights Law Protects Both Students And Educators
item.description: The law protects students from being manipulated and groomed — and teachers and counselors from being punished for telling parents the truth.
